constrained creativity

writing every day. minimal editing. done better than perfect.

About Writing

About

Hey. Welcome to my little piece of the internet. At the beginning of 2016, I told myself I was going to write for 10 minutes every day. It took me a while, but eventually I got there.

Track record:

My Writing Philosophy

I write for a few reasons:

  1. I like the idea of working out loud.
  2. To get over my anxiety around writing (I’m getting better at this, but it still…)
  3. James Baldwin is a hero and…
  4. The world definitely needs more Black, queer voices.
  5. Because Danielle Coates-Connor told me I should.
  6. To share ideas in an easily shareable way.
  7. To process my thinking in a way that allows me to build on previous thoughts.

My Approach

  1. I’m constantly collecting ideas to write about. They come from podcasts, conversations, books, and articles mostly.
  2. In the morning, after meditating for ten minutes, I set my timer for ten minutes, start Toggl, hit play on my writing playlist, and write. The ten minutes are more like a guideline at this point…
  3. When I’m done writing, I take 10-20 minutes to find links, type up quotes, and fix typoes.
  4. Hit publish.
  5. Get ready for the work day.
